channel.title: Linux Kernel Runtime Guard (LKRG) - Testers Wanted!
channel.description:
![](https://www.whonix.org/w/images/thumb/a/a7/P_lkrg2.png/470px-P_lkrg2.png) [Linux Kernel Runtime Guard](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Linux_Kernel_Runtime_Guard_LKRG) (LKRG) protects the kernel. It provides security through diversity. Similar to running an uncommon operating system (kernel) would. [[1]](https://www.openwall.com/lkrg/)
Available for [Debian](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Linux_Kernel_Runtime_Guard_LKRG#Installation), [Whonix](https://www.whonix.org), [Qubes](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Linux_Kernel_Runtime_Guard_LKRG/Qubes) [¹].
~~Known issue: [LKRG kills VirtualBox host VMs](https://www.openwall.com/lists/lkrg-users/2019/11/18/1)~~ (Fixed.)
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Linux_Kernel_Runtime_Guard_LKRG
----
[¹] Qubes Debian VMs with VM kernel only. [Qubes LKRG Instructions](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Linux_Kernel_Runtime_Guard_LKRG/Qubes)

item.description:
Linux Kernel Runtime Guard (LKRG) protects the kernel. It provides security through diversity. Similar to running an uncommon operating system (kernel) would. [1]

Available for Debian, Whonix, Qubes [¹].

Known issue: LKRG kills VirtualBox host VMs (Fixed.)

Whonix – 26 Dec 20

Linux Kernel Runtime Guard (LKRG) for Debian, Whonix, Qubes, Kicksecure

LKRG performs runtime integrity checking of the Linux kernel and detection of security vulnerability exploits against the kernel.

[¹] Qubes Debian VMs with VM kernel only. Qubes LKRG Instructions
